text: Psalm 111
Praise to God for His Work and Commands
Praise Yah!\f + \fr 111:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
I will give thanks to Yahweh with all \add my\add* heart,
in \add the\add* assembly of \add the\add* upright and \add the\add* congregation.
The works of Yahweh \add are\add* great,
studied\f + \fr 111:2 \ft Or “pondered” \f* by all \add who\add* delight \add in\add* them.
\add Full of\add* splendor and majesty \add is\add* his work,
and his righteousness endures forever.
He has made his wonders ⸤to be remembered⸥;\f + \fr 111:4 \ft Literally “a remembrance” \f*
Yahweh \add is\add* gracious and compassionate.
He gives food to those who fear him;
he remembers his covenant forever.
He has declared the power of his works for his people,
by giving to them \add the\add* inheritance of \add the\add* nations.
The works of his hands \add are\add* faithfulness and justice;
all his precepts \add are\add* reliable.
\add They are\add* sustained forever \add and\add* ever,
done with faithfulness and uprightness.
He has sent redemption to his people;
he has commanded his covenant forever;
holy and fearful \add is\add* his name.
The fear of Yahweh \add is the\add* beginning of wisdom;
all who do them\f + \fr 111:10 \ft That is, his precepts (v. \xt 7 \ft ), or the stipulations of his covenant (v. \xt 9 \ft ) \f* have a good understanding.
His praise endures forever.
